About Us

Our Mission

We aim to deliver exceptional clinical and surgical care and outcomes, achieved through outstanding skill, experience, and passion, further augmented by state of the art technology in a modern practice setting where the patient experience comes first.

Dr Natasha Dang

BMSc MD FRCSC Ophthalmology


Dr Natasha Dang is a comprehensive Ophthalmologist. Dr Dang is from Edmonton, AB; she completed a Bachelor of Medical Sciences degree at the University of Alberta, followed by her Doctor of Medicine Degree, also at the University of Alberta. She then completed a rigorous residency training program in Ophthalmology at the University of Toronto, graduating as a Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons in Ophthalmology in 2015. Throughout her training, Dr Dang was the recipient of numerous distinguished awards; she maintained a grade point average in the top 2% of university students throughout her academic career, and, among other things, was one of only twenty students in Canada to receive a prestigious national scholarship for outstanding academics and leadership. Dr Dang has been in practice as a comprehensive ophthalmologist, serving both Peel and Halton regions, since 2015.

Dr Dang has privileges at Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital (OTMH); she performs cataract surgery at OTMH, and also, provides regional emergency after hours coverage through Halton Healthcare. She is a Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons of Canada, and a member of the Eye Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario, the Canadian Ophthalmology Society, the American Academy of Ophthalmology, and the American Society of Cataract and Refractive Surgeons.
